name: chatgpt-helper
description: Make queries to OpenAI's ChatGPT from inside VS Code.

commands.title: ChatGPT: Ask why code isn't working

chatgpt-helper.model.markdownDescription: The model (Codex or ChatGPT) to answer your queries with. More pricing info at https://openai.com/pricing#chat
enumDescriptions: Uses Codex, the engine that powers GitHub Copilot to answer your queries. This model is free and uses no OpenAI credits, but may produce lower quality results.
Uses ChatGPT to answer your queries. This produces higher quality results. This model uses OpenAI credits, which will be charged to your OpenAI account associated with the linked API key.

chatgpt-helper.codex.queries.codeNotWork.default: Explanation from a helpful, creative, clever and friendly AI assistanct of what is wrong with the code:
chatgpt-helper.codex.queries.codeNotWork.description: The query to send to Codex when asking what is wrong with code. Will be sent alongside (after) the code.

chatgpt-helper.codex.queries.explainCode.default: Explanation from a helpful, creative, clever and friendly AI assistanct of what the code does:
chatgpt-helper.codex.queries.explainCode.description: The query to send to Codex when asking to explain code. Will be sent alongside (after) the code.
